metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8380 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The pcre_exec function in pcre_exec.c in PCRE before 8.38 mishandles a // pattern with a \01 string, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted regular expression, as demonstrated by a JavaScript RegExp object encountered by Konqueror.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8380` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre3 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
libpcrecpp0 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
pcregrep - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Issue affects PCRE3 only Marking 'low' since it requires PCRE to operate on untrusted regular expressions which is not very likely mdeslaur> 0001-Fix-overflow-when-ovector-has-size-1.patch in jessie

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2').
